section.title: What is Drools?
section.para: Drools is a business rule management system (BRMS) with a forward chaining inference based rules engine, more correctly known as a production rule system, using an enhanced implementation of the Rete algorithm.
In this guide we are going to get you familiar with Drools Eclipse plugin which provides development tools for creating, executing and debugging Drools processes and rules from within Eclipse.

note.title: Note:
note.para: It is assumed that you has some familiarity with rule engines and Drools in particular. If not, we suggest that you look carefully through the Drools Documentation.

section.para: Drools Tools comes bundled with the JBoss Tools set of Eclipse plugins. You can find instructions on how to install JBoss Tools in the Getting Started Guide.

section.title: Drools Tools Key Features
section.para: The following table lists the main features of Drools Tools.

entry.para: Wizard for creating a new Drools Project
The wizard provides a way to create a sample project to easily get started with Drools
Wizards for creation of new Drools resources
A set of wizards are provided with the Drools Eclipse tools to quickly create a new Rule resource, a new Domain Specific language, Decision Table and Business rule
An editor that is aware of DRL syntax and provides content assistance and synchronizing with the Outline view
An editor that provides a way to create and manage mappings from users language to the rule language
This rules allows you to build rules in a GUI driven fashion based on your object model
The editor provides a way to edit the visual graphs which represent a process (a rule flow)
